speaker: Frasier
text: Despite your healthy teen skepticism, Jeremy, problems that seem crushing now can actually serve to shape your life in positive ways later on.

speaker: Jeremy
text: [_voice over_]  You're just saying that.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, well, I'll tell you what, perhaps I can convince you with a story.  I recall a young man who suffered from involuntary bedwetting until he was twelve years old.  Or was it thirteen?  Boy, you'd think I'd remember, I slept in the lower bunk.  The point is, it was very difficult for him, what with the alarms, and the bladder stretching exercises and the incessant teasing he suffered once his schoolmates found out.

speaker: Jeremy
text: [_v.o._]  How'd they find out?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_guiltily_]  The point I'm trying to make here is that this man today is a prominent and respected psychiatrist.  And you see, his affliction served to make him stronger, more empathic, and extremely hygenic.  So, hang in there, Jeremy.

speaker: Jeremy
text: [_v.o._]  Okay.  Thanks Dr. Crane.  [_He hangs up._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  And thank you, listeners.  This is Dr. Frasier Crane saying good day and good mental health.  [_He shuts down, rises and takes off his headset as Roz comes in from her side._]

speaker: Roz
text: That was...kind of brave to admit you were a bed wetter.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, pay attention!  That was Niles, not me.  You know, I've got to run.  I'm still putting the finishing touches on my speech for the Boston conference.

speaker: Roz
text: Did you come up with a title?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  As a matter of fact, Niles will be introducing me on "Notes for a Critical Approach to Radio As Mediating Gateway in the Process of Psychological Demystification".

speaker: Roz
text: Good speech, what's the title?

speaker: Frasier
text: It promises to be a fun family weekend for all, actually. So what have you got planned for the weekend?

speaker: Roz
text: Actually, my sorority sisters are coming in for a visit.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I suppose you'll be sharing the secret handshake, doing skits, that sort of thing.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, right.  Only problem is, my apartment is just too small for everyone to stay in, and HEY your place will be empty!

speaker: Frasier
text: Say no more, Roz.  No.

speaker: Roz
text: Why not?

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, I'm sorry, Roz, it's just the idea of strangers in my apartment.  I couldn't sleep.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm sorry I asked.  [_He heads for the door, then turns back and pulls a piece of paper from his pocket._]

speaker: Frasier
text: No apologies necessary.  Oh, oh, Roz, that reminds me:  since you're going to be walking Eddie for Dad anyway, I wrote down a list of a couple of other things you can do for me.  [_She takes the list and reads it._]

speaker: Roz
text: Pick up the mail and newspapers, water the fichus, fluff your pillows?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and oh, please, don't forget to mist my bedroom with rose water.  It likes it best at dusk.  [_He hurries out as she watches, a disgusted look on her face.  Fade out._]   **AND IT TOOK FIVE DAYS TO CARVE A JACK O'LANTERN**

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I love returning to Boston.  There's just something in the air.  [_Fade in.  Frasier, Niles, Daphne and Martin are coming in from the gate area._]

speaker: Niles
text: Perhaps the toxic gas spewing from your gigantic mouth.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, please, will you just let it go?  I didn't mention your name.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no, you just said it was someone with whom you shared a bunk bed who is now a psychiatrist.  I'd say that narrows the field down to... hmm, me!

speaker: Frasier
text: But only to someone who knows that you're my brother.  And who would that be?

speaker: Niles
text: My patients.

speaker: Martin
text: The guys at work.

speaker: Daphne
text: One of the flight attendants.

speaker: Niles
text: What?  Oh, so that's why she looked at me that way when I told her I spilled my drink.

speaker: Martin
text: Would you guys come on?  I wanna see my bag come down the chute.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Dad.  [_They grab their rolling bags and start walking down the hallway._]

speaker: Niles
text: You can forget about my introducing your talk.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, you can't be serious.

speaker: Niles
text: I wouldn't even be here if Daphne didn't want to see Boston.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, I do.  So you two make up and let's go get one of those famous Boston lobsters.

speaker: Niles
text: No, it's Maine that's famous for lobsters, sweetheart. Boston is famous for beans.

speaker: Daphne
text: Beans?  What kind of a city brags about bloody beans?  [_From the bar they are passing, Frasier recognizes the familiar voice of Cliff Clavin._]

speaker: Cliff
text: Oh, that's right, your common pumpkin was once six hundred times the size of your present day variety, thereby allowing the entire fiefdom to feast all winter on the meat of a single seed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Cliff Clavin!

speaker: Cliff
text: Frasier.   You old dog, how ya doin'?  [_He comes over and they hug._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Good to see you.  Say hello to the family.  This is my brother Niles Crane.

speaker: Cliff
text: Oh, heya Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: His fiancee Daphne Moon.

speaker: Cliff
text: Enchante.

speaker: Frasier
text: And this is my dad, Martin Crane.

speaker: Cliff
text: Hey, Marty.

speaker: Martin
text: Nice to meet a fellow civil servant.

speaker: Cliff
text: Oh, you one of the brotherhood, are you?

speaker: Martin
text: I was a cop for thirty years.

speaker: Cliff
text: Oh, couldn't pass the mail carrier's exam, huh?  You know what, I can't believe you brought your entire family here for my retirement party.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually...

speaker: Cliff
text: You know, when I didn't get your RS si vous plait, I figured you weren't gonna show up.  But you son of a gun, you wanted to surprise me, didn't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes.  Surprise.

speaker: Cliff
text: You know what, I gotta go meet Ma's plane.  She's bringing in ten gallons of punch.  [_He starts to walk off._]

speaker: Cliff
text: See you guys tonight, eight o'clock sharp.

speaker: Frasier
text: At Cheers?

speaker: Cliff
text: On, no, no, no.  Sammy's got it booked for a Red Socks reunion tonight.  We're gonna be at the Somerville Town Crier.  [_He hands Frasier a slip of paper._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  [_He looks at it as Cliff walks away again._]

speaker: Niles
text: Why did you do that?  This is our one free night, I had to pull a lot of strings to get dinner reservations at L'Espalier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, you saw how thrilled he was, I couldn't say no. Besides, it'll be a chance for me to see my old friends again.  I mean, these people are an important part of my past.  They were there for me when I needed friends most.

speaker: Niles
text: How about if we move the reservation back half an hour?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that should be plenty.  [_They gather their bags and walk off again.  Fade out._]  Scene 3 - Somerville Town Crier  [_Fade in.  The room is set up with tables and a bar for Cliff's retirement party.  Frasier comes in with the others in tow._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ha, hello, everybody!  [_Everyone makes sounds of greeting.  Carla, the waitress from Cheers, comes over to hug him._]  [_N.B. Rhea Perlman's sister, Heide, writes for "Frasier," including this episode; in addition, their father Philip reprises his role from "Cheers" as Phil, a barfly._]

speaker: Carla
text: Oh, Frasier, Frasier!  Look at you.  I forgot how big your head is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Carla, you haven't changed a bit.  This is my family.

speaker: Cliff
text: Hey, everybody, why don't you try some deviled eggs.  I used Ma's special recipe: water instead of mayonnaise.

speaker: Frasier
text: No thanks.  [_Martin takes one.  Paul, one of the regulars from the bar, comes in._]

speaker: Paul
text: Hey, Fraizh!

speaker: Frasier
text: Paul, how ya doing?

speaker: Cliff
text: Paul, how'd you find out about this?

speaker: Paul
text: I live here, I just came down for some ice.

speaker: Cliff
text: Well, stay out of the way.

speaker: Paul
text: Can do.  [_Norm Peterson, Cliff's best friend, comes in._]

speaker: Norm
text: Evenin', everybody.

speaker: Everyone
text: NORM!  [_Norm walks to the end of the bar and sits on a stool._]

speaker: Cliff
text: Hey, so what's goin' down, Norm?

speaker: Norm
text: My blood-alcohol level.  [_grabbing a beer_]  Suds, do your work!  [_Frasier laughs and Norm looks up._]

speaker: Norm
text: Frasier's here?  [_He gets up and greets Frasier._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey Norm, how ya doin'?

speaker: Cliff
text: He brought his whole family, Norm.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, yeah, say hi to my brother Niles and his fiancee Daphne Moon and that's my Dad there, Martin Crane.  [_They all shake._]

speaker: Martin
text: Wow, that's some mug callous you've got there.

speaker: Norm
text: Judging from your grip, I'd say you were a can man.

speaker: Martin
text: Guilty as charged.

speaker: Norm
text: All right, well, have a seat.

speaker: Martin
text: Thanks.  [_He sits down._]

speaker: Norm
text: Listen, uh Cliffy.  Vera would have been here, so I didn't tell her about it.  [_Cliff waves in acknowledgement._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Vera is Norm's much storied wife.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that sounds fascinating.  Let me know when we're leaving.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Daphne_]  We're never going to get out of here in half an hour, why don't you and I just go?

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles, don't be rude.  These are your brother's friends, just try and loosen up.  [_Cliff comes over._]

speaker: Cliff
text: Hey, that's quite a suit you got there, buddy boy.  It what, cost over a hundred I bet, huh?  [_He grabs Niles arm and pulls him to a table._]

speaker: Cliff
text: Hey, Paul, Paul, here, feel this suit.  [_Paul reaches out and feels the material.  A man comes over._]

speaker: Phil
text: I'm next after Paul.

speaker: Cliff
text: Yeah, get in here.  [_They continue to test the material of his suit as Niles looks helpless.  Cut to - Frasier over at the bar._]

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Carla, how've you been?

speaker: Carla
text: Well, two of my kids are in jail, the bank's about to foreclose on my house and, after tonight, I'm never gonna see Cliff Clavin again.  Things are great!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to the others_]  Carla was never really a fan of Cliff's.

speaker: Carla
text: Yeah, not to talk the guy down, but he's a big blowhard who thinks he knows everything and never shuts up.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_deadpan_]  Imagine.  [_She drinks her wine as Frasier gives her a dirty look._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Norm, let me buy you a beer.  [_to bartender_]  Get a beer here?

speaker: Norm
text: Where have you been all my life?  [_Martin laughs.  Cut to - Cliff talking to Niles._]

speaker: Cliff
text: Well, e-mail did hurt us, but you know, computer's gonna be dead in about five years anyway.  Post Office will rise again, my friend, we'll rise again!  Feel that.  [_He clenches his arm and offers it to Niles who just stares, dumbfounded._]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!  [_Frasier comes over to rescue him._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm?  Oh, say, Cliff, where's your mom?

speaker: Cliff
text: Ah, Ma got on the wrong plane.  She went to Bosnia.  [_Niles just turns and walks away._]

speaker: Carla
text: Hey, Cliff, tell us more about how you're leaving.  And tell it real slow.  Quiet, everybody.

speaker: Cliff
text: Well, Carla, tomorrow I'm gettin' on a plane and going to the promised land, Florida.  Time to hang up my uniform and live in my Speedos.

speaker: Carla
text: I didn't think anything could live in your Speedos.  [_She walks off._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Aren't you a bit young to retire, Cliff?  I'd be worried I'd become bored.

speaker: Cliff
text: Oh, don't you worry about that, Missy.  When I get down there to ol' Florida, I'm gonna buy myself an airboat.  Give tours of the everglades, maybe wrestle a few crocodiles.

speaker: Niles
text: That would be alligators.

speaker: Cliff
text: Ah, common mistake there, Sparky.  See, when a crocodile raises it's head, its nostrils get pinched shut tight, thereby cutting off its oxygen supply.  Yeah, a baby could wrestle one.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's fascinating.  Did you know that, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: I, uh, I still don't.  Excuse me Daphne.  [_He walks over to Frasier._]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm?

speaker: Niles
text: If we're going to make our reservations, we're going to need to leave now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, is it that time already?

speaker: Niles
text: Already?  If I hear one more of that postman's crackpot theories, my head will explode.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, don't worry about him, nobody takes him seriously.

speaker: Daphne
text: I never knew there were so many letters in the dolphin alphabet.  [_Niles gives Frasier a sharp look._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Well, um, is Dad ready to go?

speaker: Niles
text: Dad?  Dad would be content to sit there swilling beer all night!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, it seems like everyone is having such a good time, why don't we just push the reservation back another half an hour?

speaker: Niles
text: Everyone ISN'T having a..

speaker: Paul
text: Fraizh?  Sit down and tell us what it's like to be famous.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, sure Paul!  [_to Niles_]  Better make it an hour.  [_He sits down as Niles stands there frustrated.  Fade out._]  _Act 2  Scene 1 - Somerville Town Crier_  [_Fade in.  Martin and Norm are talking at the end of the bar._]

speaker: Martin
text: The best thing is, on a summer's day, you open a cold one, and that foam runs down your hand and for a split second there, you're jealous of your own knuckles.

speaker: Norm
text: Oh, yeah.  I had no idea that you were a poet.  Yeah, tell me the one about the bacon again.

speaker: Martin
text: Which one?

speaker: Norm
text: All of 'em.  [_Cut to - Niles sitting alone.  Carla comes over and sits down._]

speaker: Carla
text: Hey, white-bread.  What could possibly be wrong on this most wonderful of nights?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no offense, it's just we had reservations at one of the finest restaurants in Boston, and instead we're eating trail mix and drinking this... [_he looks at the bottle_]  ...oh, dear God, it's just labeled "Wine".  [_Carla reaches over and taps Norm._]

speaker: Carla
text: Hey, Norm, doesn't he remind you of Frasier?  Say "indubitably".

speaker: Niles
text: Must I?

speaker: Norm
text: It's uncanny.

speaker: Carla
text: Hey, remember that time you guys took Frasier on a snipe hunt?

speaker: Norm
text: Yeah.

speaker: Niles
text: What's a snipe hunt?

speaker: Carla
text: That's when you take some unsuspecting dope out to bag snipe, which don't exist, and then you ditch 'em in the woods.

speaker: Niles
text: That must have been completely humiliating for Frasier.

speaker: Carla
text: Well, that's the point.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, do you have any more of these stories?

speaker: Carla
text: Only about a million.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I don't have time for a million, just tell me the hundred worst.

speaker: Norm
text: Okay, well, when Frasier first started coming to Cheers, he was really kind of a boob.

speaker: Paul
text: Yeah, boob.  [_They all just stare at him until he becomes embarrassed._]

speaker: Paul
text: Sorry.  [_He walks away.  Cliff taps his glass._]

speaker: Cliff
text: Everyone, attention.  Mr. Twitchell has got something to say here.

speaker: Twitchell
text: I'd like to propose a toast to Cliff Clavin.  We were often adversaries, but he was a postman and I'll say this about him:  he never developed a stoop.  Mostly because he threw the big catalogs into the river.  And even though he didn't strictly abide by the rules, especially 367 B Section 17...  [_The postal workers laugh._]

speaker: Twitchell
text: Well, anyway, when all is said and done you have to ask what will the mail be without Cliff Clavin?

speaker: Everyone
text: On time!

speaker: Cliff
text: Twitchell, thank you very much.

speaker: Phil
text: I just wanted to thank you, Cliff, for all the great times we had at Cheers.

speaker: Cliff
text: Well, you were always there for me, Al.

speaker: Phil
text: I'm Phil.  Al's been dead for fourteen years, you dumb son of a bitch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, I hadn't planned on making a speech, so my remarks will have to be extemporaneous.

speaker: Carla
text: I hope that means "dirty".

speaker: Martin
text: Smart money's on "long".

speaker: Frasier
text: It was about ten years ago when I too left Boston.  But the kind wishes and outpouring of emotions from my friends remain fresh in my mind.  I still remember Sam throwing me a lavish party and dubbing me the "Einstein of Cheers" against my modest protests that I was merely the Neils Bohr.

speaker: Carla
text: You still are!

speaker: Frasier
text: Carla, thank you.  And then of course, Norm begging me to stay and that comical moment when Woody threw his arms around my leg and began to cry.  Now another one of us is leaving this wonderful town.  Good luck, Cliff.

speaker: Everyone
text: Hear, hear.

speaker: Norm
text: Great.  I was gonna say "Good luck, Cliff."  [_He drinks his beer.  Fade out._]   **OTHER NICKNAMES HE CONSIDERED WERE "TIGER" AND "THE DUKE"**

speaker: Frasier
text: Please hold our table, we'll be there in a half hour.  [_Fade in.  Frasier is standing in the hallway outside the hall.  Cliff comes through the doors._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Cliff?  Are you all right?

speaker: Cliff
text: Oh, yeah.  Yeah, it's just I gotta...whoo take a break from all that partyin'.  [_Frasier gives him a look._]

speaker: Cliff
text: All right, you pried it out of me.  My so called friends, they don't care about me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure they do.

speaker: Cliff
text: Ah, your toast in there brought home the ugly truth.  When you left, everybody asked you to stay.  I told these mullocks six months ago I was retiring.  And not one single one of 'em has said anything like "I'm sure gonna miss you there, Big Shooter." or "Gee, I wish you could stick around, Big Shooter."

speaker: Frasier
text: "Big Shooter"?

speaker: Cliff
text: It's a nickname I once gave myself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Cliff, you know it's entirely possible that your friends are suffering from a kind of separation anxiety. They may find it difficult to admit to themselves that you are actually leaving.  You know, I could have a little talk with them if you'd like.

speaker: Cliff
text: Huh, what kind of hollow victory would that be?  [_He takes a breath._]

speaker: Cliff
text: So, if I took a walk around the block would that give you enough time?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure!  [_Cliff heads our, Frasier goes back into the reception.  Cut to - the hall as he enters._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Everybody, uh, listen up.  Cliff is going through kind of a crisis about leaving.

speaker: Carla
text: No, no he's not!  No crisis!

speaker: Frasier
text: All I'm saying is that it would go a long way toward helping him if you could just let him know how much you're going to miss him.  Tell him, you know, how sad you are that he's leaving.

speaker: Norm
text: I don't know, Fraizh.  Look, I'm his best friend, but I am no good at the mushy stuff.

speaker: Frasier
text: Surely you can come up with a few words to say, Norm.

speaker: Norm
text: Yeah, but what if he cries?  What if he tries to hug me? What are people gonna think, two guys hugging?  I, uh...  [_Carla comes up behind and grabs him by his hair._]

speaker: Carla
text: Hey!  You're gonna kiss him with tongue if that's what it takes to get rid of him.  [_Cliff comes back in._]

speaker: Carla
text: Shh.  Here he is.  Everyone pretend that you like him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Carla, we DO like him.

speaker: Carla
text: Yeah, like that.  [_Paul stands up and clears his throat._]

speaker: Paul
text: Um, I want to make a toast.  Cliff, you've always been my role model.

speaker: Cliff
text: Really?  You mean that Paul?

speaker: Paul
text: I sure do.  Especially when it comes to the ladies.  I'm sad you're going.

speaker: Everyone
text: Yeah, hear, hear.

speaker: Phil
text: Cliff, I will miss you too, you dumb son of a bitch!

speaker: Everyone
text: Hear, hear!  [_Daphne rises._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I haven't known you for very long, Cliff, but I've learned so much from you.  I never knew that the Indians of the rain forest used to stretch out pig intestines and use it as a primitive telephone.  Or that Winston Churchill invented the modern English muffin.  You're a fascinating man.  Good luck.  [_She hugs him._]

speaker: Cliff
text: Oh, thank you, Daphne.  [_He keeps holding the hug tightly even as Daphne tries to break it._]

speaker: Paul
text: He's smooth.

speaker: Niles
text: Congratulations, Cliff.  Stop that, stop it.  [_Niles pulls Daphne away.  Carla nudges Norm._]

speaker: Norm
text: Cliffy, we've been best friends for a long long time.  We've done a lot of stuff together, most of it dumb.  The rest of it boring.  But it's like we have this connection, you know?  I mean, somehow we know when we want to be dumb and when we want to be boring.  To my best friend Cliff.  [_They all raise their glasses._]

speaker: Everyone
text: To Cliff!  [_Cliff puts down his glass._]

speaker: Cliff
text: Come here, you.  [_Norm looks trapped, but gets up and goes over to him.  Cliff punches him on the arm.  Norm punches back, then they trade a quick flurry of hand slaps and blocks.  Norm goes back to his seat._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Carla?  Don't you have a few words to say?

speaker: Carla
text: I sure do.  Cliffy, I know that things haven't always been that great between us over the years, but being here tonight, makes me think about the effect that you've had on my life. I'd like to say that I'll miss you...  I'd like to say that I'll miss you...

speaker: Frasier
text: It's okay, Carla.

speaker: Carla
text: I'd like to say that I'll miss you...but it sticks in my throat like your rotten deviled eggs!  I hate your guts! The way you talk and talk and talk about nothing!  The way you walk, your stupid white socks...

speaker: Frasier
text: Carla!

speaker: Carla
text: Back off, I'm toasting!  The twenty years I've known you would have been less painful if I was covered with open sores and thrown into a pit with, with a bunch of diseased rats. But finally, you're leaving!  I know I'm not as young as I used to be, but I can live again.  I can live again! Finally, I can live!  I can live!  [_She laughs manically, stopping to see everyone staring at her._]

speaker: Carla
text: Anyway, God bless.

speaker: Everyone
text: Hear, hear.

speaker: Cliff
text: Well, I can't believe my ears.  I heard Paul and Norm there sayin' all those nice things about me, I actually started thinkin' maybe I shouldn't go to Florida, leave all my friends.  You know, am I doin' the right thing?  But when I heard you speak those words, Carla, that's when I decided. I am gonna stay!

speaker: Carla
text: What?

speaker: Cliff
text: That's right, you little dickens.  You only joke about somebody like that when you really care for them.

speaker: Carla
text: I wasn't joking!  I really hate you!

speaker: Cliff
text: Carla, come on, you're gonna make me cry.  Everyone, the move is off!

speaker: Carla
text: No!  No!  No!  [_She attacks him and the others pull her off.  Cliff laughs._]

speaker: Cliff
text: Oh, Frasier, I owe this all to you.

speaker: Carla
text: Frasier!  We were so close and then you had to show up and ruin everything!  [_The others drag her out the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we've got dinner reservations...

speaker: Cliff
text: Hey, everybody, thanks for all the gifts, but I don't have much use for a spear gun here in Boston.  [_Carla comes rushing back in._]

speaker: Carla
text: Give me that!  Give me that!  [_She grabs it and tries to take it way, but Cliff hangs on as the others grab her again and carry her out once more._]

speaker: Carla
text: Give me that!  I want that!  I have use for that!  No!  Let me go!  [_After she's gone, Frasier turns to Cliff._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, see you around, Big shooter.  [_They shake._]

speaker: Cliff
text: Thanks Doc.

speaker: Daphne
text: Good luck Cliff.  Anytime you're in Seattle...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier has an extra room.  [_Paul pulls at the nap of his jacket again.  Niles slaps his hands away and hurries Daphne out._]

speaker: Norm
text: Marty, you're not going too, are you?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I have to.  But hey, why don't you come to Seattle sometime?  I'll show you around, have a few beers at McGinty's.

speaker: Norm
text: Yeah?  You mean that?

speaker: Martin
text: Absolutely, it's only six hours flying time from here.

speaker: Norm
text: Six hours...you know sittin' there in one place, never movin'. That's, that's just not me, you know?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, all right.  [_They shake and Martin heads out.  Cut to - the hallway where Frasier and the others are getting their coats._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, I'm sorry that I ruined your evening.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, actually, I ended up rather enjoying myself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  I can't tell you how happy I am to hear that.  I knew that once you met these people you'd learn to love them as I do.

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, I've rethought a lot of things.  I'm going to give you a much deserved introduction at that conference tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you certain?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you won't be able to stop me.  [_Frasier is touched, Niles just grins.  Fade out._]  [_N.B. After this episode, the only member of the "Cheers" cast who has not appeared on "Frasier" is Rebecca Howe (Kirstie Alley).  Such an appearance is unlikely to happen, since Alley is a member of the Church of Scientology, which strongly disapproves of psychiatry._]
